page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: The foundations for a house are 60 cm deep. They use J.C.B. 3c diggers to dig them. The floor are made out of precast concrete beams and blocks and timber sheets. The precast concrete beams are shaped like an upside down "T". All of the upside down "T" are placed side by side and in the middle of them are breeze blocks. Then to finish off they place down timber sheets for the bricks. The inside wall is made of crushed concrete blocks and the insulation in the wall is a 5cm gap. The roof insulation is bits of strands of fibre. The windows are made of soft pine wood and are stained on site.
